main.docTitle: Food and Drugs (Composition and Labelling) Regulations

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Food and Drugs (Composition and Labelling) Regulations.

subsection.leadIn: In these regulations, unless the context otherwise requires—

def.name: Additive
def.leadIn: additive (添加劑) means any substance, not commonly regarded or used as food, which is added to, or used in or on, food at any stage to affect its keeping qualities, texture, consistency, appearance, taste, odour, alkalinity or acidity, or to serve any other technological function in relation to food, and includes processing aids in so far as they are added to, or used in or on, food as aforesaid, but does not include—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: herbs or spices when used as seasoning;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: hops;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: salt;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: yeast or yeast extracts;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the total products of any hydrolysis or autolysis of food protein;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: starter cultures;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: malt or malt extract;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any substance which is present in food solely as a result of its addition to animal, bird or fish feeding stuffs or its use in a process or treatment carried out in crop husbandry, animal husbandry, veterinary medicine or storage (including any pesticide, fumigant, sprout depressant or veterinary medicine); or (E.R. 3 of 2022)

paragraph.name: j

def.name: Advertisement
def.leadIn: advertisement (宣傳品) means any form of advertising intended for the general public which is published by any means including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: newspaper or other publication;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: television or radio broadcast;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: electronic messages;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: display of notices, signs, labels, showcards or goods;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: distribution of samples, circulars, catalogues, price lists or other materials; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: exhibition of pictures, models or films,

def.continued: and advertise (宣傳) shall be construed accordingly; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.def: Authority (主管當局) means the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene; (78 of 1999 s. 7)
available carbohydrates (可獲得的碳水化合物) means total carbohydrates excluding dietary fibre; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

catering establishment (飲食供應機構) means a restaurant, canteen, club, public house, school, hospital or other establishment (including a vehicle or a fixed or mobile stall) where, in the course of a business, food is prepared for delivery to the ultimate consumer for immediate consumption; (L.N. 222 of 1985)

Codex Alimentarius Commission (食品法典委員會) means the body created in 1963 by the World Health Organization and the Food and Agriculture Organization to develop food standards, guidelines and related texts; (L.N. 85 of 2004)

container (容器) includes every kind of box, bottle, tin, carton, package or wrapping enclosing an article or substance, but does not include an outer cover or wrapping superimposed for the purpose of consignment or delivery;

dietary fibre (膳食纖維) means any fibre analyzed by means of any official methods adopted by the independent organization internationally recognized as regards validating and approving analytical methods for foods and agriculture known as AOAC INTERNATIONAL; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

def.name: Energy
def.leadIn: energy (能量), in relation to any food, means the energy provided by the food which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: calculated as the total amount of energy contributed by available carbohydrates (or, if the food is infant formula, total carbohydrates), protein, total fat, ethanol and organic acids contained in the food; and (L.N. 90 of 2014)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: calculated according to the Guidelines on Nutrition Labelling adopted by the Codex Alimentarius Commission; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.def: folic acid (葉酸), in relation to any infant formula or follow-up formula, means N-pteroyl-L-glumatic acid; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

def.name: FollowupFormula
def.leadIn: follow-up formula (較大嬰兒及幼兒配方產品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: a product that, according to its descriptions or instructions for use, is—

subparagraph.content: represented as a replacement for human breast milk or infant formula; and

intended for consumption as a liquid element in a progressively diversified diet by persons of any age from 6 months to under 36 months (even if it is also claimed in the descriptions or instructions, if applicable, to be suitable for consumption by persons of any other age); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a product marked or labelled as “follow-up formula” or “較大嬰兒及幼兒配方產品”, or with any other words of similar meaning; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

def.name: FormulaForSpecialMedicalPurposesForInfantsAndYoungChildren
def.leadIn: formula for special medical purposes for infants and young children (特殊醫用嬰幼兒配方產品) means a product that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: according to its descriptions or instructions for use, is specially processed or formulated for the dietary management for, and intended for the exclusive or partial feeding of, persons of any age under 36 months (even if it is also claimed in the descriptions or instructions, if applicable, to be suitable for consumption by persons of any age from 36 months onwards)—

subparagraph.content: who have limited or impaired capacity to take, digest, absorb or metabolize ordinary food or certain nutrients in it;
who have special nutrient requirements that are determined medically; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may only be used under medical supervision; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.def: frozen confection (冰凍甜點) means any confection commonly sold for human consumption in a frozen or chilled state; (L.N. 163 of 1969)

def.name: InfantFormula
def.leadIn: infant formula (嬰兒配方產品) means—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a product that, according to its descriptions or instructions for use, is intended for consumption as a substitute for human breast milk that is specially manufactured to satisfy, by itself, the nutritional requirements of persons of any age up to and including 12 months until the introduction of appropriate complementary feeding (even if it is also claimed in the descriptions or instructions, if applicable, to be suitable for consumption by persons of any age over 12 months); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a product marked or labelled as “infant formula” or “嬰兒配方產品”, or with any other words of similar meaning; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.def: ingredient (配料) means any substance, including any additive and any constituent of a compound ingredient, which is used in the manufacture or preparation of a food and which is still present in the finished product, even if in altered form; (L.N. 222 of 1985)

International Numbering System for Food Additives (食物添加劑國際編碼系統) means the numbering system adopted by the Codex Alimentarius Commission for identifying food additives in a list of ingredients of prepackaged food; (L.N. 85 of 2004)

def.name: IonizingRadiation
def.leadIn: ionizing radiation (電離輻射) means any gamma rays, X-rays or corpuscular radiations which are capable of producing ions either directly or indirectly other than those rays or radiations which are emitted—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by measuring or inspection devices; and

paragraph.name: b

subsection.def: irradiated food (輻照食物) means any food which has been subjected to treatment by ionizing radiation; (L.N. 80 of 1996)

labelling (標籤、加上標籤), in relation to a food, includes any words, particulars, trade mark, brand name, pictorial matter or symbol relating to the food and appearing on the packaging of the food or on any document, notice, label, ring or collar accompanying the food; (L.N. 222 of 1985)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to any prepackaged food to which regulation 4B applies, means a list of nutrients required by section 1 of Schedule 5; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to any infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children, means a list of nutrients required by section 1 of Schedule 6A; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

def.name: Meat
def.leadIn: meat (肉類) means the flesh or other edible part of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any animal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any bird,

def.continued: intended for human consumption; (L.N. 116 of 1970; L.N. 222 of 1985)

subsection.def: milk (奶類) means cows milk and includes cream and separated milk but does not include dried milk, condensed milk or reconstituted milk or buffaloes milk or goats milk; (32 of 1963 s. 20)

milk beverage (奶類飲品) means any beverage resulting from the combining with a liquid of milk fat and other solids derived from milk, whether exclusive of any food additive or otherwise; (L.N. 217 of 1977)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to any infant formula, means nicotinamide together with nicotinic acid; and

paragraph.name: b
a
paragraph.leadIn: means any substance present in food which—

subparagraph.leadIn: belongs to, or is a component of, one of the following categories—
satisfies any of the following conditions—

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: the substance is needed for growth, development and normal functions of the body;

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: a deficit of the substance will cause characteristic bio-chemical or physiological changes to occur; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in Part IV of Schedule 1 and Schedule 6A, includes myo-inositol, L-carnitine and taurine; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.def: nutrient comparative claim (營養素比較聲稱) means a nutrition claim that compares the energy value or the content level of a nutrient in different versions of the same food or similar foods; (L.N. 69 of 2008)
nutrient content claim (營養素含量聲稱) means a nutrition claim that describes the energy value or the content level of a nutrient contained in a food; (L.N. 69 of 2008)
nutrient function claim (營養素功能聲稱) means a nutrition claim that describes the physiological role of a nutrient in growth, development and normal functions of the body; (L.N. 69 of 2008)
nutrient reference value (營養素參考值) means any reference value set out in Schedule 7; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means any representation which states, suggests or implies that a food has particular nutritional properties including—

subparagraph.name: ii
iii
subparagraph.content: the content of vitamins and minerals; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: includes nutrient content claim, nutrient comparative claim and nutrient function claim; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.def: permitted colouring matter (准許染色料) means any colouring matter specified in the First Schedule to the Colouring Matter in Food Regulations (Cap. 132 sub. leg. H), or any combination of such colouring matters;

def.name: PrepackagedFood
def.leadIn: prepackaged food (預先包裝食物) means any food packaged, whether completely or partially, in such a way that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the contents cannot be altered without opening or changing the packaging; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the food is ready for presentation to the ultimate consumer or a catering establishment as a single food item; (L.N. 222 of 1985)

subsection.def: prepackaged food for infants and young children (預先包裝嬰幼兒食物) means any prepackaged food that, according to its descriptions or instructions for use, is intended for consumption by persons of any age under 36 months (even if it is also claimed in the descriptions or instructions, if applicable, to be suitable for consumption by persons of any age from 36 months onwards), but does not include any infant formula or follow-up formula; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

reconstituted milk (再造奶) means products resulting from the recombining with water of milk constituents, namely, milk fat and other solids derived from milk exclusive of any other substance, and includes the products resulting from the melting of frozen concentrated milk and to reconstitute milk (再造奶) shall be construed accordingly; (L.N. 30 of 1967)
sell (售賣) includes offer or expose for sale and have in possession for sale, and sale (出售) and sold (售出) shall be construed accordingly; (L.N. 222 of 1985)
sugars (糖) means all mono-saccharides and di-saccharides present in food; (L.N. 69 of 2008)
tenderized meat (加工製嫩肉類) means meat which has been treated with proteolytic enzymes or meat derived from live animals or birds which have been so treated; (L.N. 116 of 1970)
trans fatty acids (反式脂肪酸) means the sum of all unsaturated fatty acids which contains at least one nonconjugated and trans double bond; (L.N. 69 of 2008)

def.name: UltimateConsumer
def.leadIn: ultimate consumer (最後消費者) means any person in Hong Kong who buys otherwise than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the purpose of resale;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for the purposes of a catering establishment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the purposes of a manufacturing business; (L.N. 222 of 1985; L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in Part IV of Schedule 1 and section 1(1) and (3) of Schedule 6A, means all-trans retinol, calculated in terms of Retinol Equivalent (RE) or International Unit (IU) (with 1 μg RE as being equivalent to 3.33 IU); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in any other case, means the sum of retinol and beta-carotene contained in the food, calculated in terms of RE (with 6 μg of beta-carotene as being equivalent to 1 μg RE); (L.N. 90 of 2014)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to any infant formula, means ascorbic acid together with dehydroascorbic acid; and

paragraph.name: b
a
paragraph.content: in relation to any infant formula, means d-alpha-tocopherol, calculated in terms of alpha-Tocopherol Equivalent (α-TE) or International Unit (IU) (with 1 IU as being equivalent to 0.67 mg α-TE); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to any follow-up formula, means alpha-tocopherol compounds, calculated in terms of α-TE or IU—

subparagraph.content: (for alpha-tocopherol compounds from any natural source) with 1 IU as being equivalent to 0.67 mg α-TE; or
(for alpha-tocopherol compounds from any synthetic source) with 1 IU as being equivalent to 0.45 mg α-TE; (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.def: vitamin K (維他命K), in relation to any infant formula or follow-up formula, means vitamin K1. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: In the definition of follow-up formula in paragraph (1), a reference to replacement for human breast milk or infant formula (replacing formula) includes a reference to any product that is a replacement of the replacing formula or any of its subsequent replacements. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: To avoid doubt, if any product falls within both the definitions of infant formula and follow-up formula in paragraph (1), it is to be treated for the purposes of these regulations as an infant formula but not a follow-up formula. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

For the purposes of these regulations, the supply of food, otherwise than by sale, at, in or from any place where food is supplied in the course of a business shall be deemed to be a sale of that food, and references to purchasers shall be construed accordingly. (L.N. 222 of 1985)
Subject to paragraph (2), the standards of composition of the foods and drugs specified in Schedule 1 shall be the standard prescribed in respect thereof in that Schedule. (L.N. 90 of 2014)
The item listed in Schedule 1A is exempt from the standards in Part IV of Schedule 1. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Marking and labelling
section.content: The foods and drugs specified in Schedule 2 shall be marked and labelled in the manner prescribed in that Schedule.

subsection.content: Without affecting regulations 4, 4B and 4C but subject to paragraph (2), prepackaged food shall be marked and labelled in the manner prescribed in Schedule 3. (L.N. 69 of 2008; L.N. 90 of 2014)
The items listed in Schedule 4 shall be exempt from the requirements of this regulation to the extent specified in that Schedule.
The Authority may by notice in the Gazette amend Schedule 4.

section.name: s4B
section.heading: Nutrition labelling of prepackaged food and nutrition claim

subsection.content: Without affecting regulations 4, 4A and 4C but subject to paragraphs (2), (6) and (7), prepackaged food shall be marked or labelled with its energy value and nutrient content in compliance with Part 1 of Schedule 5. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraphs (3) and (4), the following items shall be exempt from the requirement of paragraph (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any item prescribed in Part 1 of Schedule 6; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any item in respect of which an exemption has been granted under Part 2 of Schedule 6.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any item prescribed in Part 1 of Schedule 6 is marked or labelled with its energy value or any nutrient content; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any nutrition claim is made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, any item prescribed in Part 1 of Schedule 6,

subsection.continued: paragraph (1) shall apply in relation to such item.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any item in respect of which an exemption has been granted under Part 2 of Schedule 6 is labelled or displayed for sale otherwise than in the manner required by the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any nutrition claim is made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, any item in respect of which an exemption has been granted under Part 2 of Schedule 6,

subsection.continued: paragraph (1) shall apply in relation to such item.

subsection.content: Subject to paragraphs (6) and (7), any nutrition claim made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, a prepackaged food shall conform to Part 2 of Schedule 5. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: This regulation does not apply to—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: food for special dietary uses. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.content: Without affecting paragraph (6), if a prepackaged food (the food) is infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children, this regulation applies to the food only if it is claimed in its descriptions or instructions for use to be suitable for consumption by persons of any age from 36 months onwards. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

section.name: s4C
section.heading: Nutrition labelling of infant formulae, follow-up formulae and prepackaged food for infants and young children

subsection.content: Without affecting regulations 4, 4A and 4B but subject to paragraph (2), any infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children must be marked or labelled with its energy value and nutrient content in compliance with Schedule 6A.
The items listed in Schedule 6B are exempt from the requirement of paragraph (1).

Any person who advertises for sale, sells or manufactures for sale any food or drug which, subject to regulation 3(2), does not conform to the relevant requirements as to composition prescribed in Schedule 1 or which is not marked and labelled in the manner prescribed in Schedule 2 commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 222 of 1985; L.N. 330 of 1987; L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 177 of 1996; L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: Any person who advertises for sale, sells or manufactures for sale any prepackaged food which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not marked or labelled in compliance with regulation 4A(1) or 4B(1); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has on its label any nutrition claim that does not conform to regulation 4B(5),

subsection.continued: commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.name: 1AB
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any person advertises for sale any prepackaged food; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the advertisement contains any nutrition claim that does not conform to regulation 4B(5),

subsection.continued: the person commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.name: 1AC
subsection.content: Any person who advertises for sale, sells or manufactures for sale any infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children that is not marked or labelled in compliance with regulation 4C(1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Any person who sells any food after the date shown as the “use by” date on food marked or labelled for the purposes of Schedule 3 commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 177 of 1996)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Any person who, not being the manufacturer or packer originally responsible for so marking or labelling the food or drug, alters, removes or obliterates the marking or labelling of any food or drug marked or labelled for the purposes of regulation 4, 4A, 4B or 4C commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months. (L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 177 of 1996; L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings for an offence against paragraph (1), (1AA) or (1AB) in relation to the publication of an advertisement, it shall be a defence for the defendant to prove— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that before publishing, or arranging for the publication of, the advertisement, the defendant had taken all reasonable steps to ensure that all nutrition claims in the advertisement conform to regulation 4B(5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that, being a person whose business is to publish, or arrange for the publication of, advertisements, the defendant received the advertisement for publication in the ordinary course of business.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: In any proceedings for an offence against paragraph (1AC) in relation to the publication of an advertisement, it is a defence for the defendant to prove that, being a person whose business is to publish, or arrange for the publication of, advertisements, the defendant received the advertisement for publication in the ordinary course of business. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

In any proceedings for an offence against paragraph (1) or (1AA) in relation to the sale of any prepackaged food which is not marked or labelled in compliance with regulation 4, 4A(1) or 4B(1), it shall be a defence for the defendant to show that before offering the food for sale he had taken all reasonable steps to ensure that the food was so marked or labelled. (L.N. 222 of 1985; L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 90 of 2014)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Without affecting paragraph (3), in any proceedings for an offence against paragraph (1AA) in relation to any prepackaged food which is not marked or labelled in accordance with section 2(4E) of Schedule 3, it shall be a defence for the defendant to show that he— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reasonably and in good faith relied on information provided by the importer or manufacturer as to whether the food consisted of or contained any substance referred to in that section; or

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: has in good faith marked on the food that he does not know whether the food consists of or contains any such substance. (L.N. 85 of 2004 and L.N. 139 of 2004)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.content: In any proceedings for an offence against paragraph (1AC) in relation to the sale of any infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children that is not marked or labelled in compliance with regulation 4C(1), it is a defence for the defendant to show that, before offering the formula or food for sale, the defendant had taken all reasonable steps to ensure that the formula or food was so marked or labelled. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

In any proceedings for an offence against paragraph (1B), it shall be a defence for the defendant to prove that each alteration, removal or obliteration in respect of which the offence is alleged was effected under the written authorization of a person capable of effecting that alteration, removal or obliteration without contravention of that provision. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Name in which proceedings may be brought
section.leadIn: Without prejudice to the provisions of any other enactment relating to the prosecution of criminal offences, and without prejudice to the powers of the Secretary for Justice in relation to the prosecution of criminal offences, prosecutions for an offence under any of the provisions of these regulations may— (L.N. 362 of 1997)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the offence was committed in respect of drugs, be brought in the name of the Director of Health; (L.N. 76 of 1989)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the offence was committed in respect of food, in the name of the Director of Food and Environmental Hygiene. (78 of 1999 s. 7)

section.name: s7
section.heading: Compliance with other labelling requirements
section.content: Nothing in these regulations shall be construed as exempting any person from compliance with any other provisions of the Ordinance which relate to the labelling of food.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.text: (In this Schedule reference to proportion or percentage means proportion or percentage by weight)

def.name: GoodManufacturingPractice
def.leadIn: For the purposes of this Schedule, good manufacturing practice (優良製造規範) includes a manufacturing practice which complies with the following requirements—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the quantity of the additive added to food is limited to the lowest possible level necessary to accomplish its desired effect;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the quantity of the additive that becomes a component of food as a result of its use in the manufacturing, processing or packaging of a food and which is not intended to accomplish any physical, or other technical effect in the food itself, is reduced to the extent reasonably possible; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the additive is prepared and handled in the same way as a food ingredient.

part.name: P1
part.heading: Composition of Foods and Drugs other than Milk, Milk Products and Infant Formulae

section.name: s1
section.content: Drugs and ingredients and component parts of drugs shall conform to the standards specified therefor respectively in the British Pharmacopoeia or British Pharmacopoeia Codex.

section.name: s2
section.content: Margarine shall be any article of food, whether mixed with butter or not, which resembles butter and is not milk-blended butter. It shall be free from rancidity and shall contain neither more than 16% moisture nor more than 10% butter fat.

section.name: s3
section.content: Coffee shall be the seed of Coffea arabica and other species of the genus Coffea and shall contain no foreign substances.

section.name: s4
section.content: Lard shall be the clean fat rendered from the meat of the hog. It shall contain not more than 1% of substances other than hog fat unavoidably incorporated with it in the process of rendering, and not more than 1% of water. It shall not contain any foreign substance.

section.name: s5
section.content: Vinegar shall be a liquid derived wholly from alcoholic and acetous fermentations without any intermediate distillation. It shall contain not less than 4.0 grams of acetic acid in 100 cubic centimetres of the vinegar, and shall not contain any other foreign substance, except caramel. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

section.name: s6
section.content:
Malt vinegar shall be vinegar as prescribed in item 5, but it shall be derived wholly from malted barley, with or without addition of cereals, the starch of which has been saccharified by the diastase of malt.
Nothing prescribed in this item or in item 5 shall apply to Chinese native vinegar sold as such under the names of Chit Ts’o (浙醋), Pak Ts’o (白醋) or Hak Ts’o (黑醋). (L.N. 45 of 1975)

section.name: s7
section.content: Honey shall contain not more than 5% of sucrose.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: Baking powder shall yield not more than 1.5% of its weight of residual carbon dioxide and not less than 8% of its weight of available carbon dioxide, the weight of residual and available carbon dioxide, respectively, being determined in the following manner—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Residual carbon dioxide—

A sample of 2 grams of baking powder shall be treated with 25 millilitres of water and evaporated to dryness on a boiling water bath and subsequently treated with a further 25 millilitres of water and evaporated in like manner. The weight of the residual carbon dioxide is the weight evolved when the sample so treated is further treated with excess of dilute sulphuric acid at room temperature, the evolution being completed either by boiling or by means of reduced pressure. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: Available carbon dioxide—

The weight of available carbon dioxide is the difference between the total weight of carbon dioxide and the weight of the residual carbon dioxide obtained when the sample is treated in the manner prescribed in subparagraph (a), the total weight of carbon dioxide being determined by ascertaining the weight evolved when a similar sample of the baking powder is treated with excess of dilute sulphuric acid at room temperature, the evolution being completed either by boiling for 5 minutes or by means of reduced pressure. (E.R. 3 of 2022)

part.name: P2
part.heading: Composition of Milk and Milk Products

section.name: s9
section.content: Milk and reconstituted milk shall contain not less than 3.25% of milk fat, and the quantity of milk solids, other than milk fat, present in milk and reconstituted milk shall not be less than 8.5%.

section.name: s9A
section.content: A milk beverage shall contain not less than 0.1% of milk fat. (L.N. 217 of 1977)

section.name: s9B
section.content: Skimmed milk shall contain not more than 0.3% of milk fat, and the quantity of milk solids, other than milk fat, present in skimmed milk shall not be less than 8.5%. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

section.name: s9C
section.content: Semi-skimmed milk shall contain not less than 1.5% and not more than 1.8% of milk fat, and the quantity of milk solids, other than milk fat, present in semi-skimmed milk shall not be less than 8.5%. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: Cream shall consist of that part of milk rich in fat which has been—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of clotted cream, produced and separated by scalding, cooling and skimming; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in every other case, separated by skimming or otherwise. (L.N. 217 of 1977)

subsection.content: Subject to paragraphs (2) to (6), cream, howsoever described as cream, including such descriptions as single cream, pouring cream, coffee cream, fruit cream, or reconstituted cream, shall contain not less than 18% milk fat.
Sterilized cream shall contain not less than 23% milk fat.
Half cream and sterilized half cream shall contain not less than 12% milk fat.
Whipping cream and whipped cream shall contain not less than 35% milk fat.
Double cream and thick cream shall contain not less than 48% milk fat.
Clotted cream shall contain not less than 55% milk fat. (L.N. 217 of 1977)

Subject to paragraphs (1A), (1B), (1C), (1D), (1E), (3) and (6), cream shall not contain any ingredient except any additive specified in column 2 of Division 3 of Part III of this Schedule not exceeding the level specified in respect of the additive in column 3 of that Division. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: There may be added into cream to serve as stabilizers or thickeners—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: ingredients derived exclusively from milk or whey and containing 35% or more of any type of milk protein; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: milk powder.

subsection.continued: The total quantity of the ingredients and milk powder shall not exceed 20 grams per kilogram of cream. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Gelatin and starch may be added into cream to serve as stabilizers in amounts governed by good manufacturing practice. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.content: Whipped cream and cream in an aerosol container may contain carbon dioxide, nitrogen or nitrous oxide as packing gases or propellants. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.content: Fermented cream may contain starter cultures of harmless micro-organisms. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

subsection.name: 1E
subsection.leadIn: Fermented cream and acidified cream may contain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: sodium chloride;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: rennet; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other coagulating enzymes which are safe for human consumption. (L.N. 207 of 2004)

subsection.content: Cream which is sold or delivered to a manufacturer for the purpose of his manufacturing business or to a caterer for the purpose of his catering business, whipped cream and cream in an aerosol container may contain not more than 13% sugar. (L.N. 207 of 2004)
Clotted cream may contain nisin. (L.N. 217 of 1977)

section.name: s13
section.content: The product known as “half and half” consisting of a mixture of milk and cream shall contain not less than 11.5% milk fat.

section.name: s13A
section.content: The product known as recombined or reconstituted “half and half” consisting of recombined or reconstituted cream and recombined or reconstituted milk shall contain not less than 11.5% milk fat.

section.name: s14
section.content: Sweetened condensed or evaporated milk shall be milk which has been condensed by the evaporation of a portion of its water content, and to which sugar has been added, and shall contain not less than 28% of total milk solids and not less than 8% of milk fat. It shall not contain any foreign substance except sugar, salt (sodium chloride) and any additive specified in column 2 of Division 1 of Part III of this Schedule not exceeding the level specified opposite to the additive in column 3 of that Division. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

section.name: s15
section.content: Sweetened condensed skimmed or separated milk shall be skimmed or separated milk which has been condensed by the evaporation of a portion of its water content, and to which sugar has been added, and shall contain not less than 24% of total milk solids including fat. It shall contain no foreign substance other than sugar, salt (sodium chloride) and any additive specified in column 2 of Division 1 of Part III of this Schedule not exceeding the level specified opposite to the additive in column 3 of that Division. (G.N.A. 48 of 1961; L.N. 85 of 2004)

section.name: s16
section.content: Unsweetened condensed or evaporated milk shall be milk which has been condensed by evaporation of a portion of its water content, and heat-treated, and shall contain not less than 25.5% of total milk solids and not less than 7.8% of milk fat. It shall contain no foreign substance except salt (sodium chloride) and any additive specified in column 2 of Division 1 of Part III of this Schedule not exceeding the level specified opposite to the additive in column 3 of that Division. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

section.name: s17
section.content: Unsweetened condensed or evaporated skimmed or separated milk shall be skimmed or separated milk which has been condensed by the evaporation of a portion of its water content, and heat-treated, and shall contain not less than 20% of total milk solids including fat. (G.N.A. 48 of 1961)

section.name: s18
section.content: Butter shall be the clean, non-rancid fatty substance obtained by churning milk or cream. It shall contain not less than 80% of milk fat, not more than 16% of water and not more than 4% of salt (sodium chloride). It shall not be mixed with any foreign fat or oil, and it shall not contain any foreign substance except salt (sodium chloride), permitted colouring matter and any additive specified in column 2 of Division 2 of Part III of this Schedule not exceeding the level specified opposite to the additive in column 3 of that Division. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

section.name: s19
section.content: Cheese shall be the solid or semi-solid product obtained by coagulating milk with rennet or acid, with or without the addition of ripening ferments, seasonings, salt (sodium chloride) and permitted colouring matter. It shall contain not less than 30% of milk fat in its water-free substance, and it shall not contain any foreign fat.

section.name: s20
section.content: Cream cheese shall be cheese made from milk and cream. It shall contain not less than 60% of milk fat in its water-free substance.

section.name: s21
section.content: Whole-milk cheese shall be cheese made from milk. It shall contain not less than 50% of milk fat in its water-free substance.

section.name: s22
section.content: Skim-milk cheese shall be cheese made from milk from which part of the fat has been removed. It shall contain not less than 10% of milk fat in its water-free substance.

section.name: s23
section.content: Ghee shall be made from milk (including buffalo milk) and shall contain no fat other than that derived from such milk.

section.name: s24
section.leadIn: Ice cream shall contain not less than 5% fat, 10% sugar and 7 1/2% milk solids other than fat:
section.proviso: Provided that ice cream containing any fruit, fruit pulp or fruit puree shall either conform to the aforesaid standard or, alternatively, the total content of fat, sugar and milk solids other than fat shall not be less than 25% of the ice cream including the fruit, fruit pulp or fruit puree, as the case may be, and such total content of fat, sugar and milk solids other than fat shall include not less than 7 1/2% fat, 10% sugar and 2% milk solids other than fat.
section.continued: For the purpose of the aforesaid standards relating to ice cream, sugar (糖) means sucrose, sugar or the solids of any sweetening material derived from starch, provided that no ice cream shall contain less than 7 1/2% sucrose.

section.name: s1
section.content: The ratio of linoleic acid to α-linolenic acid must be at least 5:1 and not more than 15:1.

section.name: s2
section.content: The ratio of calcium to phosphorus must be at least 1:1 and not more than 2:1.

section.name: s3
section.content: The combined content of lauric acid and myristic acid must not exceed 20% of the total content of fatty acids.

section.name: s4
section.content: The content of trans fatty acids must not exceed 3% of the total content of fatty acids.

section.name: s5
section.content: The content of erucic acid must not exceed 1% of the total content of fatty acids.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: The content of vitamin E must in any case not be less than 0.5 mg α-TE/g polyunsaturated fatty acids, as adapted to the number of fatty acid double bonds in the formula using the following factors of equivalence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 0.5 mg α-TE/g linoleic acid (18:2 n-6);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 0.75 mg α-TE/g α-linolenic acid (18:3 n-3);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: 1.0 mg α-TE/g arachidonic acid (20:4 n-6);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: 1.25 mg α-TE/g eicosapentaenoic acid (20:5 n-3);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: 1.5 mg α-TE/g docosahexaenoic acid (22:6 n-3).

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: If there is any docosahexaenoic acid (DHA) added—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the content of arachidonic acid must not be less than that of DHA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the content of eicosapentaenoic acid must not exceed that of DHA.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any formula for special medical purposes for infants and young children that is marked or labelled with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “formula for special medical purposes” or “特殊醫用配方產品”, or any other words of similar meaning, in the name of the formula or in a conspicuous place of the package that is not in close proximity to other information on the package;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: a statement stating “For the dietary management of (fill in the disease, disorder or medical condition for which the formula is intended to be used or known to be effective)”, or showing any other words of similar meaning; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (if the formula poses a health hazard when consumed by a person who does not have the disease, disorder or medical condition stated in the statement) a warning statement and explanation on the hazard in bold and in a conspicuous place of the package that is not in close proximity to other information on the package.

section.name: s2
section.leadIn: Separated milk, skimmed milk, partly skimmed milk, condensed or evaporated skimmed milk and condensed or evaporated partly skimmed milk.

subsection.leadIn: Every container containing separated milk, skimmed milk, partly skimmed milk, condensed or evaporated skimmed milk or condensed or evaporated partly skimmed milk shall bear a label upon which is printed such one of the following declarations as may be applicable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of separated milk—

td.class: border_top_0.75 border_right_0.75 border_bottom_0.75 border_left_0.75 cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_right_5
