SEPARATED MILK
(離 脂 奶)
Children under one year of age should not be fed on this milk except under medical advice.
(除由醫生指導外不應用以餵哺一歲以下之嬰兒)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of skimmed milk—

td.class: border_top_0.75 border_right_0.75 border_bottom_0.75 border_left_0.75 cellpadding_right_5 cellpadding_left_5
td.center:
SKIMMED MILK
(脫 脂 奶)
Children under one year of age should not be fed on this milk except under medical advice.
(除由醫生指導外不應用以餵哺一歲以下之嬰兒)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of partly skimmed milk—

td.class: border_top_0.75 border_right_0.75 border_bottom_0.75 border_left_0.75 cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_right_5
td.center:
PARTLY SKIMMED MILK
(部 分 脫 脂 奶)
Children under one year of age should not be fed on this milk except under medical advice.
(除由醫生指導外不應用以餵哺一歲以下之嬰兒)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: in the case of condensed or evaporated skimmed milk and condensed or evaporated partly skimmed milk, whichever of the following is appropriate—

td.class: border_top_0.75 border_right_0.75 border_bottom_0.75 border_left_0.75 cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_right_5
td.center:
CONDENSED SKIMMED MILK
(脫 脂 煉 奶)
Children under one year of age should not be fed on this milk except under medical advice.
(除由醫生指導外不應用以餵哺一歲以下之嬰兒)

td.class: border_top_0.75 border_right_0.75 border_bottom_0.75 border_left_0.75 cellpadding_left_5 cellpadding_right_5
td.center:
CONDENSED PARTLY SKIMMED MILK
(部 分 脫 脂 煉 奶)
Children under one year of age should not be fed on this milk except under medical advice.
(除由醫生指導外不應用以餵哺一歲以下之嬰兒)

proviso.name: proviso
proviso.leadIn: Provided that in any such declaration—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: the words “EVAPORATED” and “蒸發” or the words “EVAPORATED” and “淡” may be substituted for the words “CONDENSED” and “煉” respectively; (L.N. 80 of 1996)

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the words “MACHINE-SKIMMED” and “機械脫脂” may be substituted for the words “SKIMMED” and “脫脂” respectively;

paragraph.name: iia
paragraph.content: the words “SEMI-” and “半” may be substituted for the words “PARTLY” and “部分” respectively; (L.N. 80 of 1996)

paragraph.name: iii
paragraph.content: if sugar has not been added to the milk, the words “UNSWEETENED” and “未加糖” may be added to the English lettering and Chinese characters respectively, which constitute the description of the milk; and

paragraph.name: iv
paragraph.content: if sugar has been added to the milk, the words “SWEETENED” and “加糖” shall be added to the English lettering and Chinese characters respectively, which constitute the description of the milk. (E.R. 3 of 2022)

subsection.leadIn: Each declaration prescribed in paragraph (1) shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be marked distinctly and legibly, in English lettering and Chinese characters;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be printed in dark block type upon a light-coloured ground or in light block type upon a dark-coloured ground;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be enclosed by a surrounding line;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: include within the surrounding line no matter other than that prescribed in paragraph (1).

subsection.content: Every label prescribed in paragraph (1) shall be securely affixed to or form part of the container, and shall be so placed on the side or top of the container as to be clearly visible.
No comment on or explanation of the prescribed declaration shall be placed on the label or container.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to the provisions of paragraph (2), every container containing reconstituted milk or reconstituted cream shall be clearly and legibly marked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: with the words “RECONSTITUTED MILK (再造奶)” or “RECONSTITUTED CREAM (再造忌廉)”, as the case may be, in English capital lettering and Chinese characters of equal size and prominence and of greater prominence than any other lettering or characters respectively appearing upon such container;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in either the English or the Chinese language or in both languages, with a declaration of the method of heat-treatment by which the contents were processed. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Every container containing reconstituted skimmed milk shall bear such label as may be approved by the Authority. (L.N. 222 of 1985)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: The Authority shall not approve a label unless he is satisfied that there has been substantial compliance with— (L.N. 222 of 1985)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the provisions of paragraph (1) relating to reconstituted milk, and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the provisions of item 2 relating to skimmed milk.

heading.inline: Pasteurized cream and ultra heat treated cream.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to paragraph (2), every container containing pasteurized cream or ultra heat treated cream shall be clearly and legibly marked as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: “PASTEURIZED” in English capital lettering and “巴士德消毒” in Chinese characters;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: “ULTRA HEAT TREATED” in English capital lettering and “超高溫處理” in Chinese characters; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: “U.H.T.” in English capital lettering and “超高溫處理” in Chinese characters,

subsection.continued: or with any one of the words or expressions in these subparagraphs.

subsection.content: Paragraph (1) shall not apply to containers containing clotted cream.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: Every container containing milk shall be clearly and legibly marked—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in either the English or the Chinese language or in both languages, with a declaration of the method of heat-treatment by which the contents were processed.

heading.inline: Beverages containing milk or reconstituted milk.

subsection.leadIn: Every container containing a beverage which includes milk or reconstituted milk and which conforms to the standard of composition specified in Part II of Schedule 1, shall be clearly and legibly marked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in either the English or the Chinese language or in both languages, with the name and address of the person by whom the contents were processed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in either the English or the Chinese language or in both languages, with a declaration of the method of heat-treatment by which the contents were processed. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

subsection.content: The Authority may in any case dispense with or relax the requirements of paragraph (1)(b). (L.N. 222 of 1985)

section.name: s6

heading.inline: Beverages described as milk or cream or resembling milk.

section.leadIn: Every container containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a beverage which includes milk or reconstituted milk but which does not conform to the standards of composition specified in Part II of Schedule 1; or (L.N. 80 of 1996)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a beverage which is described for the purpose of sale by any name, trade mark or trade description which includes the words “milk” or “cream” or the Chinese characters “奶” or “忌廉” or any word or character implying that such beverage is or contains milk or cream; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any soya bean juice or coconut juice (except in whole coconuts) or any other beverage which resembles milk either in colour, taste, appearance or consistency,

section.continued: shall be marked in a conspicuous and easily legible manner in the English and Chinese languages with an accurate description of the principal ingredients.

section.name: s6A
section.content: Any container containing follow-up formula must not be marked or labelled to the effect that the formula is suitable for consumption by persons of any age under 6 months. (L.N. 90 of 2014)

section.name: s7
section.content: Every container containing a frozen confection shall be clearly and legibly marked, in English lettering, with the name and address of the person by whom the contents were manufactured. (L.N. 163 of 1969)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Every container containing tenderized meat shall be clearly and legibly marked with the words “TENDERIZED MEAT” in capital letters and the Chinese characters “加工製嫩肉類”.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: In the case of tenderized meat which is not made up in or on a container, a label or ticket clearly and legibly marked with the words “TENDERIZED MEAT” in capital letters and the Chinese characters “加工製嫩肉類” shall be affixed or attached to that meat. (L.N. 116 of 1970; E.R. 3 of 2022)

section.name: s10
section.content: Every container containing irradiated food shall be clearly and legibly marked with the words “IRRADIATED” or “TREATED WITH IONIZING RADIATION” in English capital lettering and “輻照食品” in Chinese characters. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.heading: Marking and Labelling of Prepackaged Foods

subsection.content: Prepackaged food shall be legibly marked or labelled with its food name or designation. (L.N. 80 of 1996)
The food name or designation shall not be false, misleading or deceptive in any respect as to the nature of the food. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

If any brand name, including any fancy name, or any trade mark would be likely to mislead a purchaser in any respect as to the nature of the food, such name or mark shall be immediately followed by the word “Brand” (牌子) or the letters “TM” (商標), as appropriate, printed in legible letters or characters of not less than 3 mm in height.

Any customary or traditional name in use in Hong Kong before the commencement* of these regulations and indicative of a particular food may continue to be used as the name of that food, unless and until the Authority by notice in the Gazette prohibits such use.

subsection.leadIn: Where a purchaser could be misled by the omission of an indication—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that a food is powdered or is in any other physical condition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that a food has been dried, freeze-dried, frozen, concentrated or smoked, or has been subjected to any other treatment,

subsection.continued: the name of the food shall include or be accompanied by such an indication.

subsection.content: Prepackaged food shall be legibly marked or labelled with a list of ingredients, headed or preceded by an appropriate heading consisting of or including any of the words “ingredients” (配料), “composition” (成分組合), “contents” (內含物質) or words of similar meaning. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

Subject to subsections (3), (4), (4A) and (4B), the ingredients (other than water if it constitutes less than 5% by volume of the food) shall be listed in descending order of weight or volume determined as at the time of their use when the food was packaged. (L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 69 of 2008)

In the case of an ingredient which is used in a food in concentrated or dehydrated form and which is reconstituted during preparation of the food for consumption, the weight or volume used in determining the order of the list of ingredients may be the weight or volume of the ingredient before concentration or dehydration.

Without prejudice to subsection (3), where a food is in concentrated or dehydrated form and is intended to be reconstituted by the addition of water, its ingredients may be listed in descending order of their weight or volume in the food when reconstituted as directed, if the heading of the list of ingredients includes or is accompanied by the words “ingredients of the reconstituted product” (恢復水分產品的配料) or “ingredients of the ready to use product” (即食產品的配料) or by some other indication to similar effect. (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsection (4B), where a food consists of, or contains, mixed fruits, nuts, vegetables, spices or herbs and no particular fruit, nut, vegetable, spice or herb predominates significantly by weight, those ingredients may be listed otherwise than in descending order of weight if— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of a food which consists entirely of such a mixture, the heading of the list of ingredients includes or is accompanied by the words “in variable proportion” (可變比例) or other words indicating the nature of the order in which the ingredients are listed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a food which contains such a mixture, that part of the list where the names of those ingredients appear is accompanied by the words “in variable proportion” (可變比例) or other words indicating the nature of the order in which those ingredients are listed. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4D), where a food is characterized by— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the presence of a particular ingredient, the labelling of the food shall not place special emphasis on the presence of that ingredient, unless the labelling includes a declaration of either the minimum percentage by weight of that ingredient in the food or the actual amount of that ingredient in the food, determined as at the time of its use in the preparation of the food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the low content of a particular ingredient, the labelling of the food shall not place special emphasis on the low content of that ingredient, unless the labelling includes a declaration of either the maximum percentage by weight of that ingredient in the food or the actual amount of that ingredient in the food, determined as at the time of its use in the preparation of the food. (L.N. 80 of 1996)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: Any declaration required by subsection (4B) shall appear either— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: next to the name of the food; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the list of ingredients in close proximity to the name of the ingredient in question.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: The actual amount of an ingredient in a food referred to in subsection (4B) shall be indicated by reference to the numerical count of the contents or to the net weight or net volume of that ingredient and such indication shall conform with section 7(2). (L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.name: 4D
subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (4B)— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a reference in the labelling of a food to an ingredient which is used in a small quantity and only as a flavouring shall not of itself constitute the placing of special emphasis on the presence or low content of that ingredient; and (L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.def: ingredient (配料) does not include a nutrient. (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: If a food consists of or contains any of the following substances—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: cereals containing gluten (namely wheat, rye, barley, oats, spelt, their hybridized strains and their products);

paragraph.continued: the name of the substance shall be specified in the list of ingredients.

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: If a food consists of or contains sulphite in a concentration of 10 parts per million or more, the functional class of the sulphite and its name shall be specified in the list of ingredients. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

subsection.name: 4F
subsection.leadIn: If a food consists of or contains hydrogenated oil—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the list of ingredients must contain a reference to “hydrogenated oil”; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name of the oil, as appearing in the list of ingredients, must be qualified by the word “hydrogenated”. (L.N. 87 of 2021)

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 58 of the Ordinance and unless the Authority otherwise allows in any particular case, an additive (except an additive specified in subsection (7)) constituting one of the ingredients of a food shall be listed by its functional class and— (L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: its specific name; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its identification number under the International Numbering System for Food Additives; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its identification number under the International Numbering System for Food Additives with the prefix “E” or “e”. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

subsection.content: The functional classes of additive for the purpose of subsection (5) are— (L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 69 of 2008)
Acid (酸味劑)
Acidity regulator (酸度調節劑)
Anti-caking agent (抗結劑)
Anti-foaming agent (消泡劑)
Antioxidant (抗氧化劑)
Bulking agent (增體劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Colour (色素)
Colour retention agent (護色劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Emulsifier (乳化劑)
Emulsifying salt (乳化鹽)
Firming agent (固化劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Flavour enhancer (增味劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Flour treatment agent (麵粉處理劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Foaming agent (發泡劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Gelling agent (膠凝劑)
Glazing agent (上光劑)
Humectant (水分保持劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Preservative (防腐劑)
Propellant (推進劑) (L.N. 85 of 2004)
Raising agent (膨脹劑)
Stabilizer (穩定劑)
Sweetener (甜味劑) (L.N. 226 of 2003)
Thickener (增稠劑)

subsection.leadIn: An additive which constitutes one of the ingredients of a food and falls in any of the following classes shall be listed by the appropriate class title—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: flavour and flavouring (調味料及調味劑);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: modified starch (改性澱粉),

subsection.continued: and the expression “flavour” may be qualified by “natural”, “natural identical”, “artificial” or a combination of these words as appropriate. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

section.name: s3
section.heading: List of ingredients of exempt food
section.content: If any prepackaged food is marked or labelled with a list of ingredients notwithstanding that it is exempted from the requirements of section 2, such list shall conform in all respects with the requirements of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: Prepackaged food shall be legibly marked or labelled with the appropriate durability indication, that is to say—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: except where paragraph (b) applies, a “best before” (此日期前最佳) date; and (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a prepackaged food which, from the microbiological point of view, is highly perishable and is therefore likely after a short period to constitute an immediate danger to human health, a “use by” (此日期或之前食用) date.

subsection.leadIn: The “best before” (此日期前最佳) date shall be indicated by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “best before” in English lettering and “此日期前最佳” in Chinese characters followed by the date up to and including which the food can reasonably be expected to retain its specific properties if properly stored; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement of any storage conditions which need to be observed if the food is to retain its specific properties until that date.

subsection.leadIn: The “use by” (此日期或之前食用) date shall be indicated by— (10 of 2008 s. 27)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “use by” in English lettering and “此日期或之前食用” in Chinese characters followed by the date up to and including which the food, if properly stored, is recommended for use; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a statement of any storage conditions which need to be observed if the food is to retain its quality attributes until that date.

subsection.leadIn: The “best before” (此日期前最佳) date shall be shown either in Arabic numerals or in both the English and Chinese languages and, subject to subsection (7), shall be expressed in terms of a day, a month and a year except that— (L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: in the case of a food which can reasonably be expected to retain its specific properties for more than 3 but not more than 18 months, the date may be expressed in terms of a month and a year if the date is preceded by the word “end” in English lettering and is followed immediately by the word “底” in Chinese character; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in the case of a food which can reasonably be expected to retain its specific properties for more than 18 months, the date may be expressed either in terms of a month and a year or in terms of a year, if the date is preceded by the word “end” in English lettering and is followed immediately by the word “底” in Chinese character. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

subsection.content: The “use by” (此日期或之前食用) date shall be shown either in Arabic numerals or in both the English and Chinese languages and, subject to subsection (7), shall be expressed in terms of a day and a month or in terms of a day, a month and a year. (L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 69 of 2008)

The “best before” (此日期前最佳) date or the “use by” (此日期或之前食用) date may appear on the labelling of a food separately from the words immediately preceding the date, provided that those words are followed by a reference to the place where the date appears.

subsection.leadIn: Where the “best before” (此日期前最佳) date or the “use by” (此日期或之前食用) date is shown in Arabic numerals— (10 of 2008 s. 57)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the day shall be indicated by the words “DD”, “dd”, “D” or “d” in English lettering and “日” in Chinese character;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the month shall be indicated by the words “MM”, “mm”, “M” or “m” in English lettering and “月” in Chinese character; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the year shall be indicated by the words “YY”, “yy”, “Y” or “y” in English lettering and “年” in Chinese character,

subsection.continued: and the day, month and year can appear in any order. (L.N. 85 of 2004)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Statement of special conditions for storage or instructions for use

subsection.content: Where special conditions are required for the storage of a prepackaged food, a statement of such conditions shall be legibly marked or labelled on the food.
Where special instructions are needed in order that appropriate use may be made of a prepackaged food, such instructions shall be legibly marked or labelled on the food.
Any statement or instructions marked or labelled on food under this section shall conform so far as possible with other requirements of this Schedule. (L.N. 69 of 2008)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Name and address of manufacturer or packer

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2) or (3), prepackaged food shall be legibly marked or labelled with the full name or business name and the full address or details of the registered or principal office of the manufacturer or packer. (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to prepackaged food if— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is marked or labelled with—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an indication of its country of origin;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the name of the distributor or brand owner in Hong Kong; and

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: the address of the registered or principal office of the distributor or brand owner in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the full address of the manufacturer or packer of the food in its country of origin has been notified in writing to the Authority by the distributor or brand owner in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) shall not apply to prepackaged food if— (L.N. 69 of 2008)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is marked or labelled with an indication of its country of origin and with a code marking identifying the manufacturer or packer in that country; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: particulars of the code marking and of the manufacturer or packer to whom it relates have been notified in writing to the Authority by the manufacturer or packer or by the distributor or brand owner in Hong Kong; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the factory or other place where the food was manufactured or packed is owned, run or managed by the government of its country of origin and the food is marked or labelled in such a manner as to indicate that it is a product of that government.

subsection.content: Prepackaged food shall be clearly marked or labelled with the numerical count of the contents or with the net weight or net volume of the food.

The net weight and net volume shall, so far as is practicable, be indicated in accordance with the Weights and Measures Ordinance (Cap. 68) or with the International System of Units set out in the First Schedule to the Metrication Ordinance (Cap. 214).

Except as provided in section 4(2), (3), (4), (5) and (7) and subject to subsection (3), the marking or labelling of prepackaged food for purposes of this Schedule shall be in either the English or the Chinese language or in both languages. (L.N. 80 of 1996; L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 69 of 2008)

If both the English and Chinese languages are used in the labelling or marking of prepackaged food, the name of the food and the list of ingredients shall appear in both languages, but otherwise the requirements of this Schedule need only be met in one of those languages.

Unless the Authority otherwise requires in any particular case, any prepackaged food may, if it is national or traditional to the country of its manufacture and is not generally manufactured in any other country, be marked and labelled in accordance with this Schedule in the language of the country of its manufacture.

p.span: Parts of Schedule 3 from which item is exempt

td.p: Drinks with an alcoholic strength by volume of more than 1.2% but less than 10% as determined under section 53 of the Dutiable Commodities Ordinance (Cap. 109) (L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 139 of 2004)
The whole Schedule except sections 3 and 4
Prepackaged food sold at a catering establishment for immediate consumption
Individually wrapped confectionery products in a fancy form intended for sale as single items
Individually wrapped preserved fruits which are not enclosed in any further packaging and which are intended for sale as single items
Prepackaged food packed in a container the largest surface of which has an area of less than 10 cm2 (L.N. 313 of 1985)
Carbonated water, to which no ingredient other than carbon dioxide has been added and the description of which indicates that it has been carbonated
Vinegar which is derived by fermentation exclusively from a single basic product and to which no other ingredient has been added

td.leadIn: Cheese, butter, fermented milk and fermented cream, to which no ingredient has been added other than—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: lactic products, enzymes and micro-organism cultures essential to the manufacture of the item; or

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the salt needed for the manufacture of mature cheese

td.p: Any food consisting of a single ingredient other than hydrogenated oil (L.N. 87 of 2021)
Sugar with no added ingredients other than preservatives
Chewing gums and other similar products (L.N. 80 of 1996)

Wines, liqueur wines, sparkling wines, aromatised wines, fruit wines, sparkling fruit wines and other drinks with an alcoholic strength by volume of 10% or more as determined under section 53 of the Dutiable Commodities Ordinance (Cap. 109) (L.N. 85 of 2004; L.N. 139 of 2004)

subsection.leadIn: Prepackaged food shall be legibly marked or labelled with a list of nutrients setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the energy value of the food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the content of the following nutrients contained in the food—

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if applicable, the content of any other nutrient contained in the food for which a nutrition claim is made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, the food.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to subsection (1), the content of any other nutrient contained in the food may also be set out in the list of nutrients.

Without prejudice to subsection (1), if a prepackaged food has on its label, or in its advertisement, a nutrition claim which is made in relation to any type of fat contained in the food, the content of cholesterol contained in the food shall also be set out in the list of nutrients.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1)(b)(ii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: available carbohydrates may be marked or labelled on a list of nutrients as “carbohydrates” or “碳水化合物”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the content of total carbohydrates contained in a prepackaged food may be set out in a list of nutrients in substitution of the content of available carbohydrates provided that the content of dietary fibre contained in the food is also set out in the list of nutrients.

subsection.content: Other information may be set out in a list of nutrients provided that such information is not false, misleading or deceptive in any respect as to the nutritional or dietary value of the food.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the energy value to be set out in a list of nutrients shall be expressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in kilocalorie (kcal) per 100 g or 100 mL of food; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in kilojoule (kJ) per 100 g or 100 mL of food.

subsection.leadIn: The energy value to be set out in a list of nutrients may be expressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the package contains a single serving, in kilocalorie (kcal) or kilojoule (kJ) per package;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the package contains a single serving, in kilocalorie (kcal) or kilojoule (kJ) per serving if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the single serving is quantified in gram (g) or millilitre (mL) and is specified to be so on the package; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is specified on the package that the package contains one serving;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the package contains more than one serving, in kilocalorie (kcal) or kilojoule (kJ) per serving if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a single serving is quantified in gram (g) or millilitre (mL) and is specified to be so on the package; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of servings contained in the package is specified on the package.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsections (1) and (2), the energy value may further be expressed as the ratio (as a percentage) of the energy value to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nutrient reference value of energy; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other reference value of energy adopted by any national or international health authority.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the content of nutrients referred to in section 1(1)(b) and (c) and (3) to be set out in a list of nutrients shall be expressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in gram (g) per 100 g or 100 mL of food;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in milligram (mg) per 100 g or 100 mL of food; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in microgram (μg) per 100 g or 100 mL of food.

subsection.leadIn: The content of nutrients referred to in section 1(1)(b) and (c) and (3) to be set out in a list of nutrients may be expressed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: where the package contains a single serving, in gram (g), milligram (mg) or microgram (μg) per package;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: where the package contains a single serving, in gram (g), milligram (mg) or microgram (μg) per serving if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the single serving is quantified in gram (g) or millilitre (mL) and is specified to be so on the package; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is specified on the package that the package contains one serving;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the package contains more than one serving, in gram (g), milligram (mg) or microgram (μg) per serving if—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a single serving is quantified in gram (g) or millilitre (mL) and is specified to be so on the package; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the number of servings contained in the package is specified on the package.

subsection.leadIn: Without prejudice to subsections (1) and (2), the content of a nutrient may further be expressed as the ratio (as a percentage) of the content of that nutrient to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the nutrient reference value of that nutrient; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other reference value of that nutrient adopted by any national or international health authority.

subsection.content: If the content of any other nutrient is expressed as a percentage in a list of nutrients, the content of that nutrient shall be expressed in the manner specified in subsection (3).
Subject to subsection (2), a list of nutrients shall be presented in tabular form in a conspicuous place of the package with an appropriate heading.
A list of nutrients may be presented in linear form if the total surface area of the package is smaller than 200 cm2.

subsection.leadIn: The marking or labelling of prepackaged food for the purposes of this Schedule shall be in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the English language;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chinese language; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: both languages,

subsection.continued: but numbers may be expressed in Arabic numerals.

subsection.content: Without prejudice to section 8(2) of Schedule 3, a list of nutrients shall be in both the English and Chinese languages if both languages are used in the marking or labelling of prepackaged food.

Unless the Authority otherwise requires in any particular case, any prepackaged food may, if it is national or traditional to the country of its manufacture and is not generally manufactured in any other country, be marked or labelled in accordance with this Schedule in the language of the country of its manufacture.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Nutrition claim
section.leadIn: For the purposes of these regulations, the following do not constitute a nutrition claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: mention of any nutrient content in a list of ingredients required by section 2 of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any quantitative or qualitative declaration of any nutrient content specified in section 2(4E)(a) of Schedule 3;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: other quantitative or qualitative declaration of energy value or any nutrient content required by law;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any quantitative or qualitative declaration of change in nutritional value due to genetically modified process;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any claim forming part of the name, brand name or trade mark of a prepackaged food; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: any quantitative declaration of energy value or any nutrient content contained in a prepackaged food which—

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: in any manner specified in section 2 or 3; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: does not place any special emphasis on the high content, low content, presence or absence of energy or that nutrient contained in the food.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Nutrient content claim
section.leadIn: A nutrient content claim shall not be made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, a prepackaged food unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the claim is made for energy or a nutrient specified in column 2 of Schedule 8 contained in the food;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: the food satisfies the applicable condition set out in column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the word “Energy” or the name of the nutrient concerned specified in column 2 of that Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the relevant description specified in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: A nutrient comparative claim shall not be made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, a prepackaged food unless the claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: compares the energy value or the content level of a nutrient specified in column 2 of Schedule 8;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: compares different versions of the same food or similar foods;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: compares foods of the same quantity;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: conforms to subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: satisfies the conditions prescribed in subsection (3), (4), (5), (6), (7), (8) or (9), as applicable.

subsection.leadIn: The following information shall appear in close proximity to a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a description of the foods being compared;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the difference in the energy value or the content level of a nutrient between the foods being compared expressed—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.leadIn: as an absolute value in the manner specified in (as applicable)—

subsection.leadIn: If energy value is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relative value of the difference in the energy value between the foods being compared shall not be less than 25%; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than the maximum amount set out in column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Low” content specified for energy in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the content level of total fat, sugars or sodium is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than the maximum amount set out in column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of the nutrient concerned specified in column 2 of that Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the description of “Low” content specified for that nutrient in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the content level of saturated fatty acids or cholesterol is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than the maximum amount set out in paragraph (a)(i) or (b)(i) of column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of the nutrient concerned specified in column 2 of that Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the description of “Low” content specified for that nutrient in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the content level of trans fatty acids is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than the maximum amount set out in paragraph (a)(i) or (b)(i) of column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Free” content specified for trans fatty acids in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the content level of protein is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.leadIn: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of solid food, the minimum amount set out in paragraph (a) or (c) of column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Source” content specified for protein in column 3 of that Schedule;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of liquid food, the minimum amount set out in paragraph (b) or (c) of column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Source” content specified for protein in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the content level of dietary fibre is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than the minimum amount set out in column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Source” content specified for dietary fibre in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the content level of any vitamin or mineral provided with a nutrient reference value (except sodium) is compared in a nutrient comparative claim—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the relative value of the difference in the nutrient reference value of such vitamin or mineral between the foods being compared shall not be less than 10%; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the absolute value of the difference shall not be less than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of solid food, the minimum amount set out in paragraph (a) or (c) of column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Source” content specified for vitamins and minerals provided with nutrient reference values (except sodium) in column 3 of that Schedule;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of liquid food, the minimum amount set out in paragraph (b) or (c) of column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to the description of “Source” content specified for vitamins and minerals provided with nutrient reference values (except sodium) in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: A nutrient function claim shall not be made on the label of, or in any advertisement for, a prepackaged food unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the claim conforms to subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: subject to subsection (3), the content of the nutrient concerned is not less than the minimum amount set out in column 4 of Schedule 8 opposite to—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the name of that nutrient specified in column 2 of that Schedule; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the description of “Source” content specified for that nutrient in column 3 of that Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: A nutrient function claim shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: not be made for a nutrient which is not—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: provided with a nutrient reference value; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be based on scientific substantiation and scientific consensus; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain information on the physiological role of the nutrient concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1)(b) does not apply to a nutrient function claim made for a nutrient which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not specified in column 2 of Schedule 8; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is specified in column 2 of Schedule 8 but no description of “Source” content has been specified for that nutrient in column 3 of that Schedule.

schedule.name: sch6
schedule.heading: Items Exempt from Part 1 of Schedule 5

part.name: P1
part.heading: Items Exempt from Part 1 of Schedule 5 under Regulation 4B(2)(a) of these Regulations

section.name: s1
section.content: Prepackaged food with an alcoholic strength by volume of more than 1.2% as determined in the manner described in the definition of alcoholic strength in section 53 of the Dutiable Commodities Ordinance (Cap. 109).

section.name: s2
section.content: Prepackaged food sold at a catering establishment which is usually bought for immediate consumption.

section.name: s3
section.content: Individually wrapped confectionery products in a fancy form intended for sale as single items.

section.name: s4
section.content: Individually wrapped preserved fruits which are not enclosed in any further packaging and which are intended for sale as single items.

section.name: s5
section.content: Prepackaged food packed in a container which has a total surface area of less than 100 cm2.

section.name: s6
section.leadIn: Fruit or vegetable, whether fresh, chilled, frozen or dried—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: packed in a container which contains no other ingredient; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to which no other ingredient has been added.

section.name: s7
section.leadIn: Carbonated water—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to which no ingredient other than carbon dioxide has been added; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the marking or label of which indicates that it has been carbonated.

section.name: s8
section.content: Spring water and mineral water (including water to which minerals have been artificially added and which is described as mineral water).

section.name: s9
section.content: Prepackaged food which does not have any energy value or contain any content of any nutrient referred to in section 1(1)(b) of Schedule 5.

section.name: s10
section.leadIn: Meat, marine or fresh water fish or any other form of aquatic life commonly used for human consumption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is in a raw state;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: packed in a container which contains no other ingredient; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to which no other ingredient has been added.

section.name: s11
section.leadIn: Prepackaged food containing assorted ingredients which is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prepared and sold to an ultimate consumer at the same premises;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: not intended for sale for immediate consumption; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: intended to be subjected to a process of cooking for the purpose of rendering it fit for human consumption.

section.name: s12
section.leadIn: Soup pack containing assorted ingredients—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which has not been subjected to any process of heating in the course of manufacture;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is not intended for sale for immediate consumption; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: which is intended to be subjected to a process of cooking for the purpose of rendering it fit for human consumption in the form of soup.

section.name: s13
section.leadIn: Prepackaged food sold—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a charitable institution or trust of a public character which is exempt from tax under section 88 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in an event held for charitable purposes.

section.name: s14
section.leadIn: Prepackaged food—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: processed and sold to an ultimate consumer at the same premises; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: processed at a place which is adjacent to, or in the immediate vicinity of, the premises where the food is sold to an ultimate consumer,

section.continued: and not offered for sale outside the premises referred to in paragraph (a) or (b).

section.name: s15
section.content: Prepackaged food sold to a catering establishment as a single item.

td.def: processed (加工處理) includes any treatment or process resulting in a substantial change in the natural state of any food, and processing (加工處理) in the definition of prepared in this Note shall be construed accordingly.

part.name: P2
part.heading: Prepackaged Food with Annual Sales Volume not Exceeding 30 000 Units may be Exempt from Part 1 of Schedule 5 under Regulation 4B(2)(b) of these Regulations

subsection.content: Upon an application made under subsection (2), the Authority may, subject to section 3(1), grant an exemption in respect of any prepackaged food from the requirements of Part 1 of Schedule 5 if the Authority is satisfied that the annual sales volume of food of the same version in Hong Kong would not exceed 30 000 units.
Any importer or manufacturer of a prepackaged food may apply to the Authority for exemption under subsection (1) in such manner as the Authority may determine.

subsection.leadIn: On the approval of an application made under subsection (2), the following is payable by the applicant to the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application is made electronically by means of an online communication system provided by the Authority for the purpose, $265; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is made in any other manner, $345. (L.N. 3 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: impose such conditions as the Authority may deem fit; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require the applicant to give an undertaking to comply with such conditions as the Authority may from time to time impose with regard to the prepackaged food to which the exemption applies.

subsection.leadIn: An exemption granted under subsection (1) shall be valid—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: (where only one other exemption granted under that subsection is for the time being in force in relation to the version of the prepackaged food concerned) until the expiry date of that other exemption; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (where 2 or more other exemptions granted under that subsection are for the time being in force in relation to the version of the prepackaged food concerned) until the expiry date of the first of such exemptions.

subsection.leadIn: Upon an application made under subsection (2), the Authority may, subject to section 3(2), renew an exemption granted under section 1(1) if the Authority is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: (where no other exemption granted under section 1(1) is for the time being in force in relation to the version of the prepackaged food concerned) the total sales volume of the version of the prepackaged food in Hong Kong within the validity period of the exemption would not exceed 30 000 units;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (where only one other exemption granted under section 1(1) is for the time being in force in relation to the version of the prepackaged food concerned) the total sales volume of the version of the prepackaged food in Hong Kong within the validity period of that other exemption would not exceed 30 000 units; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: (where 2 or more other exemptions granted under section 1(1) are for the time being in force in relation to the version of the prepackaged food concerned) the total sales volume of the version of the prepackaged food in Hong Kong within the validity period of the first of such exemptions would not exceed 30 000 units.

subsection.content: A person to whom an exemption has been granted may, before the expiration of the exemption, apply to the Authority for renewal of the exemption in such manner as the Authority may determine.

subsection.leadIn: On the approval of an application made under subsection (2), the following is payable by the applicant to the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the application is made electronically by means of an online communication system provided by the Authority for the purpose, $250; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the application is made in any other manner, $335. (L.N. 3 of 2014)

subsection.leadIn: A renewal under subsection (1) takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the day following the expiration of the exemption; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a period of one year or such lesser period as may be specified by the Authority.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Refusal to grant, refusal to renew or revocation of exemption

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may refuse to grant an exemption under section 1(1) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant has, in relation to the prepackaged food to which the application relates, failed to comply with any condition imposed under section 1(4) within the past 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the annual sales volume of the version of the prepackaged food to which the application relates in Hong Kong exceeded 30 000 units in any one of the past 2 years.

subsection.content: The Authority may refuse to renew an exemption under section 2(1) if the applicant has, in relation to the prepackaged food to which the application relates, failed to comply with any condition imposed under section 1(4) within the past 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke an exemption granted under section 1(1) or renewed under section 2(1) (the exemption) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the importer or manufacturer to whom the exemption has been granted (the grantee) has failed to comply with any condition imposed under section 1(4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the total sales volume of the version of the prepackaged food to which the exemption applies in Hong Kong within the validity period of the exemption exceeds 30 000 units.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority shall not revoke an exemption unless the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: notifies the grantee in writing of—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: his intention to revoke the exemption; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: the grounds upon which the Authority proposes to revoke the exemption;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: permits the grantee to make representations to the Authority in writing within the period specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: considers the representations, if any, made by the grantee.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority revokes an exemption, the Authority shall, as soon as practicable, notify the grantee in writing and specify in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the grounds for the revocation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the date on which the revocation is to take effect.

subsection.content: A revocation takes effect on the expiry of 30 days from the date on which the decision to revoke the exemption is made.

schedule.name: sch6A
schedule.heading: Nutrition Labelling of Infant Formulae, Follow-up Formulae and Prepackaged Food for Infants and Young Children

subsection.leadIn: Any infant formula must be legibly marked or labelled with a list of nutrients setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the energy value of the formula; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the content of the following nutrients contained in the formula—

subsection.leadIn: If the fluoride content of any infant formula (in a form that is reconstituted or served according to any instructions for use provided) exceeds 100 μg per 100 kcal or 24 μg per 100 kJ, the formula must be marked or labelled with a statement—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: indicating that consumption of the formula may cause dental fluorosis; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: recommending that the risk of dental fluorosis should be discussed with a medical practitioner or health professional.

subsection.leadIn: Any follow-up formula must be legibly marked or labelled with a list of nutrients setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the energy value of the formula; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the content of the following nutrients contained in the formula—

subsection.leadIn: Any prepackaged food for infants and young children must be legibly marked or labelled with a list of nutrients setting out—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the energy value of the food; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the content of the following nutrients contained in the food—

subsection.content: Without affecting subsections (1), (3) and (4), the content of any other nutrient contained in the infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children may also be set out in the list of nutrients.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (3)(b)(iii) and (4)(b)(iii)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: available carbohydrates may be marked or labelled on the list of nutrients as “carbohydrates” or “碳水化合物”;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the content of total carbohydrates may be set out in the list of nutrients in substitution of the content of available carbohydrates if the content of dietary fibre is also set out in the list of nutrients.

subsection.content: Other information may be set out in a list of nutrients if the information is not false, misleading or deceptive in any respect as to the nutritional or dietary value of the infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children.

subsection.leadIn: The energy value to be set out in a list of nutrients for any infant formula must be expressed in kilocalorie (kcal) or kilojoule (kJ), or both—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: per 100 g of the formula (in a form ready for sale); or

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: per 100 mL of the formula (in a form ready for sale, or in a form that is reconstituted or served according to any instructions for use provided).

subsection.leadIn: The energy value to be set out in a list of nutrients for any follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children must be expressed in kilocalorie (kcal) or kilojoule (kJ), or both—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: per 100 g of the formula or food (in a form ready for sale);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: per 100 mL of the formula or food (in a form ready for sale, or in a form that is reconstituted or served according to any instructions for use provided); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: per suggested serving as specified in gram (g) or millilitre (mL).

subsection.leadIn: The content of nutrients referred to in section 1(1)(b) of this Schedule to be set out in a list of nutrients for any infant formula must be expressed (for protein, total fat and total carbohydrates) in gram (g) or (for the other nutrients) in an appropriate unit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: per 100 g of the formula (in a form ready for sale); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: per 100 mL of the formula (in a form ready for sale, or in a form that is reconstituted or served according to any instructions for use provided).

subsection.leadIn: The content of nutrients referred to in section 1(3)(b) or (4)(b) of this Schedule to be set out in a list of nutrients for any follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children must be expressed (for protein, total fat and available carbohydrates) in gram (g) or (for the other nutrients) in an appropriate unit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: per 100 g of the formula or food (in a form ready for sale);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: per 100 mL of the formula or food (in a form ready for sale, or in a form that is reconstituted or served according to any instructions for use provided); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: per suggested serving as specified in gram (g) or millilitre (mL).

subsection.leadIn: Without affecting subsections (1) and (2), the content of nutrients referred to in section 1(1)(b) or (3)(b) of this Schedule to be set out in a list of nutrients for any infant formula or follow-up formula may further be expressed (for protein, total fat, total carbohydrates and available carbohydrates) in gram (g) or (for the other nutrients) in an appropriate unit—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: per 100 kcal of the formula; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: per 100 kJ of the formula.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a list of nutrients for any infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children must be presented in tabular form in a conspicuous place of the package with an appropriate heading.
A list of nutrients for prepackaged food for infants and young children may be presented in linear form if the total surface area of the package is less than 200 cm2.

subsection.leadIn: The marking or labelling for the purposes of this Schedule must be in—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the English language;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Chinese language; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: both languages.

subsection.content: However, numbers may be expressed in Arabic numerals.

A list of nutrients must be in both the English and Chinese languages if both languages are used in the marking or labelling of the infant formula, follow-up formula or prepackaged food for infants and young children.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any formula for special medical purposes for infants and young children that is marked or labelled with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the words “formula for special medical purposes” or “特殊醫用配方產品”, or any other words of similar meaning, in the name of the formula or in a conspicuous place of the package that is not in close proximity to other information on the package;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.content: a statement stating “For the dietary management of (fill in the disease, disorder or medical condition for which the formula is intended to be used or known to be effective)”, or showing any other words of similar meaning; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: (if the formula poses a health hazard when consumed by a person who does not have the disease, disorder or medical condition stated in the statement) a warning statement and explanation on the hazard in bold and in a conspicuous place of the package that is not in close proximity to other information on the package.

section.name: s2
section.content: Any infant formula or follow-up formula packed in a container that has a total surface area of less than 250 cm2.

section.name: s3
section.content: Any prepackaged food for infants and young children packed in a container that has a total surface area of less than 100 cm2.
